Description: Limestone ostracon: on recto and verso respectively, nine and six lines of text containing an appeal by the workman Nekhemmut to oracle of Amenhotep I over thefts by unknown people. On verso in opposite direction to this text four erased lines of an earlier memorandum.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: S. Birch, 'Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character, from the Collections of the British Museum' (London, 1868), pl. XV; A. M. Blackman, 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 12 (1926), pp. 183ff., pls. 37-42; S. Allam, 'Hieratische Ostraka und Papyri aus der Ramessidenzeit' (Tubingen, 1973), no. 23, pp. 50-51; K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' V (Oxford 1983), 577; A.G. McDowell, 'Jurisdiction in the Workmen's Community of Deir el-Medina' (Leiden, 1990), pp. 139-40, 228.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136357) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136357)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006/8 Sept-Sept, Wallsend, Segedunum Roman Fort & Baths Museum, Egypt Revealed 2009 May-present, Newcastle, Great North Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
